result.execSummary:
The defendant Herbert E. Clause Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $250 applied from cash bond posted in 14CM195

With Huber for all purposes. May serve in Oneida County or Vilas County.
DNA Sample

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per Jack at ONSO - now in custody Oneida County

per Amy @ ONSO - detainer - Vilas County
(WF added)
No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant
Case not called on record. Attorney Burns statement to adjournment. Case scheduled for review hearing on February 13, 2017 at 3:00 p.m. Attorney Burns to notify defendant of date.

Deft called and stated he could not make it to review hearing and has no money. Explained to Deft that he has had 6 MO to either arrange payment plan or ride to hearing and that a warrant could be authorized if he did not show up.
notified Mary at ONSO - she will notify Vilas that detainer no longer needed

3:11 p.m. Defendant Herbert E. Clause in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Defendant Herbert E. Clause in custody.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cm76 and 14cm195. Sowinski - State moves to dismiss 14cm195 - Granted. In 16cm76 - Sowinski statement on agreeement. Plea questionnaire filed. Court quashes warrant. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Sowinski/Burns/Court statement on sentencing.
Court sentence
Jail -  8 days with Huber for all purposes. May serve in Oneida or Vilas County. 
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Costs/DNA surcharge -   Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.

Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given. Defendant to contact court if still incarcerated at review date.
Adj. 3:24 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for December 12, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 15, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
per Judy @ ONSO - detainer - Vilas Cty

2:39 p.m. Attorney Mary L. Roth Burns in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Burns has no information as to defendant's whereabouts - State requests warrant. Court authorizes warrant. Adj. 2:39 p.m.
Bond Must be signed and returned to Clerk within 20 days.

1:39 p.m. Attorney Mary L. Roth Burns in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Burns - files Authorization - defendant is in Vilas County jail -   In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea. Schiek/Burns statement on bond. Court sets $1000 sig bond. Adj. 1:41 p.m. 
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 17, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

1:43 p.m. Attorney Mary L. Roth Burns in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Burns statement that she found out about case when she checked CCAP. Defendant is in Vilas County jail and Burns believes he is unaware of today's date. Burns will obtain Authorization for next hearing date. Adj. 1:45 p.m.  Initial appearance scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Herbert E. Clause not in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
